Desc.entry: Runs 6 day centres throughout the city for older people who are socially isolated or housebound. Provides a hot meal. Applications can be made by professionals or by self-referrals. Places are limited (usually 10-15 per session), dependent on the Day Centre's resources. There may be a waiting list. Day centres for older people who are housebound/isolated include Tannery Lodge, Painted Fabrics, Manor and Arbourthorne. Day centres for older people suffering from mild/moderate dementia include Horner House and Eastfield. A health care worker referral is needed for the dementia day centres. A formal diagnosis of dementia must have been made by a medical professional e.g consultant. Run by Age Concern, a registered charity.
